sub_title: Supervisor - R&D/Product Dvl Engineering at TE Connectivity
summary:
•	Performance-driven professional with over 10+ years of rich & extensive experience in New product Development, Cross-functional Coordination and People Management.
•	Able to understand the market strategies and drive the task with more commitment towards achieving reduced time to market.
•	Expert in terminal and connector design for signal and power application (High Speed, High voltage, and EV Market).
•	Experience in evaluation and introduction of new surface technologies (Plating) for 10K+ mating cycles for electrical vehicle terminal, harsh environment terminals, signal terminals.
•	Processed various invention disclosures from work which includes, 
        9 Patents (6 Granted, 3 Under IPO examination)
•	TEchCon2014 - INNOVATER Game Winner 2014,
        Topic EV Charge Monitor - Electric Vehicle Charge Monitor Adapter/App/Cloud

inventors.headline: Supervisor - R&D/Product Dvl Engineering at TE Connectivity

profile_positions.description: Responsible for development of terminals for customer Renault and Stellantis
profile_positions.title: Supervisor - R&D/Product Dvl Engineering

profile_positions.description:
•Leading Platform Product Engineering team (4 Team members), which deal in creating/design New terminal design, introduction of new plating technologies for automotive industry.
•Leading Platform element engineering team (2 Team members), which deal in creating/design standard platform elements, standard crimp specification and other standard designing elements.
•Responsible for Product Engineering Team deliverables like Concept & Design Review, Risk Analysis, DFMEA, Product Validation, Product Release Activities for PAC (Project Approval Committee) from Definition Phase to Industrial Phase of new terminal development projects.
•Responsible for introduction of MBD (Model Based Definition) Process, Creation of Standard Work Instructions for new process, Creation Quality Management Process for New Product Development Process.
•Responsible for KPI matrix of platform team like customer milestones, delivery performance, first time right design.
profile_positions.title: Supervisor - R&D/Product Dvl Engineering

profile_positions.description:
•	Lead Platform Product Engineering team of 4 members, which deals in creating/design New terminal design for automotive industry.
•	Responsible for designing, validating, and launching of TH025 Terminal, NG8, NG12 Terminals, HPF terminal, HSD terminals as per customer requirements.
•	Lead the team to implement the ISO GPS / GD&T and creation of APM (Accurate part model) for ~50 contact cavity families to accelerate the digital validation process.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	Lead the team to implement and validate the multiple metal material supplier sources for terminal (Stamped Metal components) for strengthening material supply chain.
•	Implemented the Agile simulation (Creo-Simulate) in global product engineering group to improve the design lead time, increase the simulation capabilities within product engineering group by evaluating the Creo-Simulation software.
profile_positions.title: Associate Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	Partnered with engineering teams in Germany on the design, validation and launch of MCON8, MCON12, HPF1.2 Terminals.
•	Started and Setup the terminal development team of 3 members in India.
•	Increase the team capabilities on terminal design competency by providing required trainings, coach the team while executing real time projects.
•	Responsible for GPS / GD&T Implementation & Trainings for the India Automotive Engineering Team for MBD preparedness.
profile_positions.title: Senior Product Engineer

profile_positions.description:
•	Visited Germany - Bensheim to avail training on Contact Physics and Terminal Design Fundamentals between May'2015 to Aug'2015.
•	Responsible for designing and realizing the Volvo charging Inlet brackets and LED light module for electric vehicles. Received customer appreciation for quick concept generation and design verification, Received “Star of the Quarter Award”.
•	Visited Germany between Jan’2014 to Feb’2015 for executing the Volvo charging inlet project.
•	Partnered with engineering teams in Germany on the design, validation and launch of Type I, Type II, GB Generation 1 & 2 charging inlets.
•	Responsible for designing of GB 1st Gen charging inlet for customer BMW.
profile_positions.title: Engineer-Product Engineering

profile_positions.description:
•	Served on the new product development team – HEMS (Hybrid Electric Mobility Solution) and contributed to designing different charging inlets (Type1, Type2) based on IEC, SAE.
•	Undergone the trainings on Connector design, molding, Stamping, assembly technologies, Creo CAD (Formerly ProE), PDMLink, Space Claim, etc.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Engineering Trainee

skills: Design Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (DFMEA)
